DOCNAME: CASE OF ROLF GUSTAFSON v. SWEDEN
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant is a NORP citizen resident in GPE . Since DATE he has spent a total of DATE in prison for the commission of serious economic offences . Most recently , in DATE he was sentenced to a DATE term of imprisonment for a serious forgery offence .

CARDINAL . ORG The applicant claims that on CARDINAL occasions , in DATE and PERSON , he was the victim of kidnapping and extortion perpetrated by CARDINAL persons . According to the applicant , one of the alleged perpetrators , a certain PERSON , had wanted to be paid for the part he played with him in the commission of certain economic crimes .

ORG In the criminal proceedings instituted against PERSON before ORG ( tingsrätt ) , the applicant requested the court , pursuant to the provisions of chapter CARDINAL of LAW ( PERSON : see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , to order PERSON to pay him a total of MONEY ( SEK ) in compensation in respect of the following items :

The applicant reserved his right to present further claims in respect of any such damage as he might suffer in the future .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant applied for compensation to ORG ( Brottsskadenämnden - hereinafter " the ORG " ) under LAW DATE ( brottsskadelagen CARDINAL:CARDINAL - hereinafter " LAW " ; see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) . In his application he stated that he had sought compensation for personal injury in the amount of SEK CARDINAL,CARDINAL in the proceedings against L. and that he had reserved his right to make any further claims with regard to future damage . In view of the rules on prescription of compensation claims , he submitted to ORG at that stage a claim for compensation of SEK CARDINAL,CARDINAL along the lines stated above . He enclosed a copy of the indictment against L.

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG convicted PERSON , sentenced him to six years’ imprisonment and ordered him to pay SEK CARDINAL,CARDINAL in damages to the applicant . ORG found , inter alia , that , on the whole , the applicant could not be considered a particularly trustworthy person in view of the fact that he had been convicted of several economic offences ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . It stated , however , that this fact did not in itself mean that his allegations concerning his kidnapping and extortion were untrue and it found the evidence to be such that the prosecution ’s case against PERSON had been partially proven .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE ORG ( PERSON hovrätt ) reversed ORG decision on the ground that the charges against PERSON had not been proven , acquitted PERSON and rejected the applicant ’s claim for compensation . ORG found that the applicant , in view of his criminal background , could not be deemed a trustworthy person . It followed that the information he had provided on the events which had given rise to the charges against PERSON ( åtalade händelserna ) could not , in the absence of strong supporting evidence , ground PERSON ’s conviction , even though the applicant ’s evidence had been corroborated by others whom he had told about the incidents .
The applicant did not seek leave to appeal to ORG ( ORG domstolen ) against the decision .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant , referring to his application for compensation of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , asked the Board to proceed with its examination of his claim , stating that he had no insurance which would cover the damage in question . He supplied the ORG with copies of the judgments of ORG and ORG .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s compensation claim , stating as follows :

" A condition for a grant of compensation is that damage has in fact been caused by crime . ORG ... can not find it established that [ the applicant ] has suffered damage as a result of crime . Consequently , compensation for damage caused by crime can not be awarded . "

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant requested ORG to reconsider its decision . He argued that it was clear from the judgments of ORG and ORG that he had been the victim of a crime and that he had suffered the damage for which he requested compensation . He had identified CARDINAL of the QUANTITY persons who were allegedly involved in the offences ; the fact that ORG had not found it proven that the only one to be charged , PERSON , was guilty was not a reason to doubt that he had been the victim of crime .

In support of his request for reconsideration of the decision the applicant submitted a copy of the investigation report concerning the alleged kidnappings and extortions , including a medical report drawn up on DATE by Dr PERSON , a Deputy Senior Physician . According to this report , on DATE the applicant had sought emergency care for his right eye , which he stated had been punched . He had been operated on by PERSON on DATE and had remained hospitalised until DATE . On DATE he underwent a further operation . Dr Berglin concluded in his report that the applicant ’s eye injury could have been caused by a punch .

He had interrogated both the applicant and PERSON on a number of occasions . Inspector PERSON had told ORG , inter alia :

A colleague ... telephoned me to say that he had been informed that [ the applicant ] had been kidnapped ... , that the kidnapping had been staged by [ L. ] with the help of CARDINAL ‘ ORG , ... and that the kidnapping had been combined with an extortion threat against [ the applicant ] in the amount of MONEY . ... He stated that [ they had been carried out ] by CARDINAL black men and CARDINAL one , whom he did not wish to name ... He repeated several times that CARDINAL kidnapping had taken place in DATE ] and [ the other ] towards DATE [ CARDINAL ] , lasting until DATE [ CARDINAL ] ... We took [ the applicant ’s statements ] seriously ... I have come to know [ the applicant ] so well that I can somehow see when he is lying or when he is telling the truth ... In the autumn [ of DATE ] he named CARDINAL of the assistants [ during the kidnappings ] , [ P. ] ... CARDINAL . ORG Both PERSON report and Crime Inspector S. ’s testimony had in essence been reproduced in ORG judgment . Inspector PERSON had also been heard orally before ORG , where he had more or less repeated the same evidence he gave to ORG .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s request , for the following reasons :

" The submissions in this case in support of the request for reconsideration are not such as to be a reason for the ORG to change its previous decision . Nor is there any other reason for changing the decision . "

CARDINAL . ORG Under chapter CARDINAL , section CARDINAL , of LAW , a private claim arising from a crime may be lodged against the suspect or a third party in connection with the prosecution of the offence . If it concerns an offence forming the object of public charges , the prosecutor is under an obligation to prepare and present any such claim as the victim may wish to make , provided that it is not seriously inconvenient to do so and that the claim is not manifestly unfounded ( section CARDINAL ) . In that event , the trial court will in principle determine the claim for compensation as well as the questions of guilt and sentencing . This is the most frequently used course of action for obtaining compensation for criminal damages .
A private claim against the suspect may in the alternative be made by way of a civil action under the general rules on tort liability contained in LAW DATE .

Otherwise , and at the relevant time , compensation could have been sought from the ORG under the rules of LAW , which was amended as of DATE . LAW was enacted in order to afford crime victims a means of obtaining reparation where the identity of the offender was unknown or where the latter had insufficient means to compensate the victim or where insurance coverage was inadequate .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the DATE Act read , in so far as is relevant :
" This Act regulates compensation to be paid by the ORG for damage caused by crime . The LAW is applicable if the crime has been committed in GPE ... "
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Ordinance on Damage Caused by Crime ( brottsskadeförordningen CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) read , at the time in question and in so far as is relevant :

" ... The claim [ for compensation for damage caused by crime ] shall be lodged with ORG . The claim shall be supported by a police record , a medical statement and other documents of relevance to the [ ORG ’s ] examination . If someone has been convicted of the crime referred to in the request or if someone has been ordered to pay damages , a copy of the judgment [ to this effect ] shall also be enclosed . If no police investigation has been carried out , other material concerning the cause of the damage shall be submitted . "
CARDINAL . Section DATE Act provided :

" A claim for compensation for damage caused by crime shall be filed within DATE from the date of the offence . If there are special reasons , a claim may be examined even if it has been lodged out of time . A claim will only be examined if the offence has been reported to the public prosecutor or the police or if the applicant shows a valid reason why such a report has not been made . "

CARDINAL . ORG Although it was not a condition for compensation under LAW that the offender had been convicted , it was a condition that the damage had been caused by criminal conduct and that both the subjective and objective conditions for the offence in question had been fulfilled .

ORG decided independently whether the conditions for compensation under LAW had been fulfilled , including whether a crime had been committed . Thus , in some cases ORG had been satisfied that the conditions for compensation had been met , despite a decision by the public prosecutor not to bring charges on the ground of lack of evidence . In rare instances , ORG had granted compensation even though the trial court , because of insufficient evidence , had acquitted the accused or had dismissed the compensation claim . Generally speaking , the standard of proof applied by ORG was less strict than that applied by a trial court .

CARDINAL . Compensation could be granted under LAW for physical injury suffered by the victim but could , on certain conditions , also cover damage to property . Other damage could be compensated to a limited extent ( sections DATE of LAW ) .

CARDINAL . ORG No appeal lay against a decision of ORG ( section CARDINAL of LAW ) . Nor was it possible to request judicial review of the decision pursuant to LAW ( Rättsprövningslagen CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG The ORG set up under LAW was composed of a chairperson , CARDINAL vice - chairpersons and CARDINAL other members , all of whom were appointed by the Government for a limited period ( section CARDINAL of the Ordinance with Instructions for ORG CARDINAL:CARDINAL med instruktion för brottsskadenämnden ) ) . It was a requirement that the chairperson , the vice - chairpersons and their substitutes be lawyers ( " vara lagfarna " ) and have experience as judges ( section CARDINAL of LAW ) . The remaining CARDINAL members did not need to be lawyers , but CARDINAL of them had to be a representative of the insurance business .

The ORG ’s independence was guaranteed by LAW , Article CARDINAL , of ORG ( Regeringsformen ) , which provision implies that neither the ORG nor ORG could intervene or influence the manner in which ORG dealt with an individual case .

CARDINAL . ORG The rules governing the procedure before ORG were similar to those found in LAW ( PERSON ) and LAW DATE ( ORG CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) . Thus , for instance , the rules on disqualification of members of ORG from dealing with a case ( sections CARDINAL of LAW DATE ( ORG CARDINAL ) were similar to those applying to members of the ordinary courts ( chapter DATE , section CARDINAL , of the Code of Judicial Procedure ) and the administrative courts ( section CARDINAL of LAW ) . Although the ORG in principle determined cases on the basis of the case file , a party to the proceedings had the possibility to make oral arguments before ORG , if the latter considered it expedient ( LAW DATE ) . A party was entitled to have access to all written documents in a case , unless non - disclosure was required by a strong public or private interest under LAW ( Sekretesslagen CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) . In such a case the party concerned should be informed of the contents of such facts in order to enable him to protect his rights , provided this could be done without serious harm to those interests which are protected by secrecy . No case could be decided on before the parties had been informed of all the evidence adduced and had been given an opportunity to submit observations in reply .
Subject to the provisions in LAW , all documents submitted to ORG were accessible to the public .

CARDINAL . ORG Under the new legislation adopted on DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , a new public body has been established for the examination of compensation requests , i.e. the Authority for Victims of Crime ( Brottsoffermyndigheten ) . Within that authority a board examines cases of particular interest or cases that are otherwise of particular importance .
